1.text: I am the true vine, and my Father is the farmer.

2.text: Every branch in me that bears not fruit he takes away: and every branch that bears fruit, he purges it, that it may bring forth more fruit.

3.text: Now you are clean through the word which I have spoken to you.

4.text: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; no more can you, except you abide in me.

5.text: I am the vine, you are the branches: He that stays in me, and I in him, the same brings forth much fruit: for without me you can do nothing.

6.text: If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered; and men gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they are burned.

7.text: If you abide in me, and my words abide in you, you shall ask what you will, and it shall be done to you.

8.text: Herein is my Father glorified, that you bear much fruit; so shall you be my disciples.

9.text: As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you: continue you in my love.

10.text: If you keep my commandments, you shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and abide in his love.

11.text: These things have I spoken to you, that my joy might remain in you, and that your joy might be full.

12.text: This is my commandment, That you love one another, as I have loved you.

13.text: Greater love has no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.

14.text: You are my friends, if you do whatever I command you.

15.text: From now on I call you not servants; for the servant knows not what his lord does: but I have called you friends; for all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known to you.

16.text: You have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordained you, that you should go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain: that whatever you shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.

17.text: These things I command you, that you love one another.

18.text: If the world hate you, you know that it hated me before it hated you.

19.text: If you were of the world, the world would love his own: but because you are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

20.text: Remember the word that I said to you, The servant is not greater than his lord. If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they have kept my saying, they will keep yours also.

21.text: But all these things will they do to you for my name’s sake, because they know not him that sent me.

22.text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they had not had sin: but now they have no cloak for their sin.

23.text: He that hates me hates my Father also.

24.text: If I had not done among them the works which none other man did, they had not had sin: but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father.

25.text: But this comes to pass, that the word might be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me without a cause.

26.text: But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send to you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceeds from the Father, he shall testify of me:

27.text: And you also shall bear witness, because you have been with me from the beginning.
